p: The main compound found in the methanol leaves extract of Quercus suber was gentisic acid [ 84]. However, another study performed by Yin et al. [ 85], who analyzed the 50% ethanol crude extract of Mongolian oak cups, demonstrated that ellagic acid (EA) and kaempferol derivatives were the main phenolic components. Moreover, Sari et al. [ 83] reported five compounds, which are lyoniresinol-9- O- β-xylopyranoside, lyoniresinol- 9- O- β-glucopyranoside, (-)-8-chlorocatechin, polydatin, and cocciferoside that occur in the Quercus coccifera bark.
